## GAD-7 vs DEBQ

GAD-7 vs DEBQ For psychologists and researchers conducting comparative study between Generalised Anxiety Disorder Assessment (GAD-7) and Dutch Eating Behaviour Questionnaire (DEBQ), effective harmonisation is vital. This is where Harmony comes into the picture. Harmony is a software designed specifically to aid in questionnaire item harmonisation, even across different languages. With 'GAD-7 vs DEBQ' forming the core of your study, Harmony's powerful Natural Language Processing and AI-based models can be immensely beneficial. When undertaking a 'GAD-7 vs DEBQ' analysis, Harmony offers the capability to compare questionnaire items, providing a percentage match between each item. You can simply select the GAD-7 and DEBQ from Harmony's comprehensive database, or upload your own versions in PDF form. This flexibility and ease of use make Harmony an invaluable tool in questionnaire harmonisation and will streamline your 'GAD-7 vs DEBQ' evaluation process. Furthermore, Harmonyâ€™s multilingual feature adds another dimension to its usefulness in a 'GAD-7 vs DEBQ' study. If you are working with non-English versions of GAD-7 or DEBQ, Harmony can effortlessly handle the comparisons and harmonisation. In essence, Harmony is a versatile, user-friendly tool that eliminates the manual, time-consuming process of questionnaire harmonisation. Whether your focus is 'GAD-7 vs DEBQ' or any other set of questionnaires, Harmony is the way to go.

## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
